result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ian G Magolan was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.   Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the City of Waukesha Police Department.  
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.  Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  
*If accepted into Alcohol Treatment Court; Participation in Alcohol Treatment Court.

May NOT enter any bar, tavern, liquor store, or any place that primarily sells alcohol.  Maintain/Obtain full-time employment or school or any other program deemed appropriate by the Agent.
15TR7004 and 16CM146 are dismissed and read in. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit of 2 days was granted.  Commencing forthwith.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

supervisions.notes:
FIRST 14 days to be served as STRAIGHT TIME followed by 226 days with Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit to be determined.

6/15/2017 - DEFENDANT DISCHARGED FROM ATC.  DEFENDANT IS TO SERVE BALANCE OF ORIGINAL SENTENCE, PLUS IS ENTITLED TO ADDITIONAL CREDIT SINCE RELEASED FROM HUBER TO ATC ON 11/11/2016 OF: 120 DAYS CREDIT.  DEFENDANT REMAINS IN CUSTODY.
Fine and Costs previously ordered by the Court to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/17 and each month thereafter or penalty of 30 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ian G Magolan in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  Court finds defendant guilty as to count #1.   State makes recommendations to the Court.  Attorney Bricco makes statements to the Court.  Defendant makes statements to the Court.  

The Court Orders the Following to Count #1:

***WITHHELD SENTENCE***

Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription
May not enter any bar, tavern, liquor store, or any place that primarily sells alcohol
Maintain/Obtain full time employment or school or any other program deemed appropriate by the agent
75 Hours of Community Service
If accepted into Alcohol Treatment Court; Participation in Alcohol Treatment Court

Condition Time: 80 Days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. (2 days credit)

FINE:  $1445.00  Apply cash bail previously posted on 15CM2436 and 15CM985 the balance is to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  Apply cash bail previously posted on 15CM2436 and 15CM985 the balance is to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha  Police Department.

DL REVOCATION:  32 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 32 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel on: 11/9/16.
